metadata.title: CVE-2024-10459 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could have caused a use-after-free when accessibility wasenabled, leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 132, Firefox ESR < 128.4, Firefox ESR < 115.17,Thunderbird < 128.4, and Thunderbird < 132.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-10459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.18.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
